Title: 1. Titanic
description: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

Title: 2. Men in Black
description: James, an NYC cop, is hired by Agent K of a secret government agency that monitors extraterrestrial life on Earth. Together, they must recover an item that has been stolen by an intergalactic villain.

Title: 3. The Lost World: Jurassic Park
description: A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda.

Title: 4. Liar Liar
description: A pathological liar-lawyer finds his career turned upside down when he inexplicably cannot physically lie for 24 whole hours.

Title: 5. Air Force One
description: Communist radicals led by Ivan Korshunov hijack Air Force One with US President James Marshall and his family on board. Vice President Kathryn Bennett negotiates from Washington D.C., while Marshall fights to rescue the hostages on board.

Title: 6. As Good as It Gets
description: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.

Title: 7. Good Will Hunting
description: Will Hunting, a janitor at MIT, has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

Title: 8. My Best Friend's Wedding
description: When a woman's long-time friend reveals he's engaged, she realizes she loves him herself and sets out to get him, with only days before the wedding.

Title: 9. Tomorrow Never Dies
description: James Bond sets out to stop a media mogul's plan to induce a war between China and the United Kingdom.

Title: 10. Face/Off
description: To foil a terrorist plot, an FBI agent assumes the identity of the criminal who murdered his son via facial transplant surgery, but the crook wakes up prematurely and vows revenge.

Title: 11. Batman & Robin
description: Batman and Robin try to keep their relationship together even as they must stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from freezing Gotham City.

Title: 12. George of the Jungle
description: A man raised in the jungle by apes falls in love with a wealthy American heiress.

Title: 13. Scream 2
description: Two years after the first series of murders, as Sidney acclimates to college life, someone donning the Ghostface costume begins a new string of killings.

Title: 14. Con Air
description: Newly-paroled ex-con and former U.S. Ranger Cameron Poe finds himself trapped in a prisoner-transport plane when the passengers seize control.

Title: 15. Contact
description: Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.

Title: 16. Hercules
description: The son of Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it.

Title: 17. Flubber
description: An absent-minded professor discovers "flubber," a rubber-like super-bouncy substance.

Title: 18. Conspiracy Theory
description: A taxi driver with a penchant for conspiracy theories becomes a target after one of these theories turns out to be true. Unfortunately, to save himself, he has to figure out which theory it is.

Title: 19. I Know What You Did Last Summer
description: Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town.

Title: 20. Dante's Peak
description: A volcanologist arrives at a countryside town recently named the second-most desirable place to live in America, and discovers that a nearby long-dormant volcano may awaken at any moment.

Title: 21. Anaconda
description: A "National Geographic" film crew is taken hostage by an insane hunter, who forces them along on his quest to capture the world's largest - and deadliest - snake.

Title: 22. L.A. Confidential
description: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

Title: 23. In & Out
description: A midwestern teacher questions his sexuality after a former student makes a comment about him at the Academy Awards.

Title: 24. The Fifth Element
description: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.

Title: 25. Mousehunt
description: Two stumblebum inheritors are determined to rid their antique house of a mouse who is equally determined to stay where he is.

Title: 26. The Saint
description: Simon "The Saint" Templar (Val Kilmer), is a thief for hire, whose latest job to steal the secret process for cold fusion puts him at odds with a traitor bent on toppling the Russian government, as well as the woman who holds its secret.

Title: 27. The Devil's Advocate
description: An exceptionally adept Florida lawyer is offered a job at a high-end New York City law firm with a high-end boss - the biggest opportunity of his career to date.

Title: 28. Kiss the Girls
description: Police hunting for a serial kidnapper are helped when a victim manages to escape for the first time.

Title: 29. Jungle 2 Jungle
description: A man learns he has a thirteen-year-old son who was raised in the jungle and brings the boy to New York City, turning his life upside down in the process.

Title: 30. Anastasia
description: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with her grandmother, the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.

Title: 31. Life Is Beautiful
description: When an open-minded Jewish waiter and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

Title: 32. The Jackal
description: An imprisoned I.R.A. fighter is freed to help stop a brutal, seemingly "faceless" assassin from completing his next job.

Title: 33. Spawn
description: An elite mercenary is killed, but comes back from Hell as a reluctant soldier of the Devil.

Title: 34. Starship Troopers
description: Humans, in a fascist militaristic future, wage war with giant alien bugs.

Title: 35. Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
description: A world-class playboy and part-time secret agent from the 1960s emerges after thirty years in a cryogenic state to battle with his nemesis Dr. Evil.

Title: 36. Breakdown
description: A man searches for his missing wife after his car breaks down in the middle of the desert.

Title: 37. Absolute Power
description: Career thief Luther Whitney (Clint Eastwood) witnesses a horrific crime involving U.S. President Alan Richmond (Gene Hackman).

Title: 38. Volcano
description: A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city.

Title: 39. Speed 2: Cruise Control
description: A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker.

Title: 40. The Game
description: After a wealthy San Francisco banker is given an opportunity to participate in a mysterious game, his life is turned upside down as he begins to question if it might really be a concealed conspiracy to destroy him.

Title: 41. G.I. Jane
description: Lt. Jordan, a US Navy topographic analyst, joins the US Navy Special Warfare Group and struggles to prove her worth in a unit dominated by men. But a cynical woman Texan senator has sold her out.

Title: 42. Alien Resurrection
description: Two centuries after her death, a powerful human/alien hybrid clone of Ellen Ripley aids a crew of space pirates in stopping the aliens from reaching Earth.

Title: 43. The Full Monty
description: Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.

Title: 44. The Rainmaker
description: A newly minted lawyer who's just passed the bar exam takes on a fraudulent insurance company in a multi-million dollar lawsuit.

Title: 45. Bean
description: The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum.

Title: 46. Cop Land
description: The Sheriff of a suburban New Jersey community, populated by New York City police officers, slowly discovers the town is a front for mob connections and corruption.

Title: 47. Nothing to Lose
description: Nick's wife is in bed with his boss. He later gets a gun to his head by a carjacker but steps on the gas pedal. They end up friends after adventures together:holdups, burglary, reckless driving, and revenge. Twists follow.

Title: 48. Amistad
description: In 1839, the revolt of Mende captives aboard a Spanish owned ship causes a major controversy in the United States when the ship is captured off the coast of Long Island. The courts must decide whether the Mende are slaves or legally free.

Title: 49. Soul Food
description: One person can keep a family together and, when that one person is gone, a family can be torn apart.

Title: 50. Wag the Dog
description: Shortly before an election, a spin-doctor and a Hollywood producer join efforts to fabricate a war in order to cover up a Presidential sex scandal.

Title: 51. The Devil's Own
description: A police officer uncovers the real identity of his house-guest, an I.R.A. terrorist in hiding.

Title: 52. Donnie Brasco
description: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the Mafia life--at the expense of his regular one.

Title: 53. The Peacemaker
description: A US Army colonel and a civilian woman supervising him must track down stolen Russian nuclear weapons before they're used by terrorists.

Title: 54. Private Parts
description: The autobiographical story of Howard Stern, the radio rebel who is now also a TV personality, an author and a movie star.

Title: 55. Money Talks
description: Sought by police and criminals, a small-time hustler makes a deal with a TV newsman for protection.

Title: 56. Jackie Brown
description: A flight attendant with a criminal past gets nabbed by the ATF for smuggling. Under pressure to become an informant against the illegal arms dealer she works for, she must find a way to secure her future without getting killed.

Title: 57. Seven Years in Tibet
description: Heinrich Harrer, an Austrian climber, breaks out of prison and travels to the holy city of Lhasa. He is employed as an instructor to the 14th Dalai Lama and soon becomes his close confidante.

Title: 58. Vegas Vacation
description: In the fourth outing for the vacation franchise, the Griswolds have to survive Vegas fever when they go to Las Vegas for a fun family vacation.

Title: 59. Mortal Kombat: Annihilation
description: A group of martial-arts warriors has only six days to save the Earth from an extra-dimensional invasion.

Title: 60. Selena
description: The true story of Selena, a Texas-born Tejana singer who rose from cult status to performing at the Astrodome, as well as having chart-topping albums on the Latin music charts.

Title: 61. Addicted to Love
description: Maggie's and Sam's former partners are in love; she wants revenge and he wants his lost love back, so they work together to break up the happy couple.

Title: 62. The Relic
description: A homicide detective and an anthropologist try to destroy a South American lizard-like God, who's on a people eating rampage in a Chicago museum.

Title: 63. Metro
description: A Hostage Negotiator teams up with a Sharpshooter to bring down a dangerous jewel thief.

Title: 64. For Richer or Poorer
description: An unhappily-married Manhattan socialite couple flee from the IRS and end up in Amish country, where they pretend to be visiting relatives.

Title: 65. Beverly Hills Ninja
description: Years ago in Japan a baby is found by a ninja clan who raise him as there own. Years later he is now a clumsy oaf who lacks ninja skills and due to a mix up he gets an opportunity to prove himself when an American woman begs for his help.

Title: 66. Picture Perfect
description: Shy awkward young Mercer Advertising Agency executive Kate Mosley's life becomes increasingly complicated when she attempts to impress her boss by pretending to be engaged to wedding photographer Nick, whom she has just met.

Title: 67. Home Alone 3
description: Alex Pruitt, an 8-year-old boy living in Chicago, must fend off four international criminals who are seeking a top-secret microchip in his toy car.

Title: 68. Fools Rush In
description: After a one-night stand with Alex, Isabel realizes that she is pregnant and they decide to get married. However, along with the marriage comes compromise of one's own cultural traditions.

Title: 69. Spice World
description: World-famous pop group the Spice Girls zip around London in their luxurious double-decker tour bus having various adventures and performing for their fans.

Title: 70. Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
description: Two dim-witted, inseparable friends hit the road for their ten-year high school reunion and concoct an elaborate lie about their lives in order to impress their classmates.

Title: 71. Out to Sea
description: A failed gambler, intent on meeting a rich widow, tricks his widowed brother-in-law into boarding a cruise ship as dance hosts.

Title: 72. Fathers' Day
description: A woman cons two old boyfriends into searching for her runaway son by convincing both that they are the boy's father.

Title: 73. Grosse Pointe Blank
description: Professional assassin Martin Blank is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe--where, by coincidence, his 10-year high-school reunion party is about to take place.

Title: 74. The Edge
description: An intellectual billionaire and two other men struggle to band together and survive after getting stranded in the Alaskan wilderness with a blood-thirsty Kodiak Bear hunting them down.

Title: 75. Event Horizon
description: A rescue crew is tasked with investigating the mysterious reappearance of a spaceship that had been lost for seven years.

Title: 76. An American Werewolf in Paris
description: An American man unwittingly gets involved with French werewolves who have developed a serum allowing them to transform at will.

Title: 77. Boogie Nights
description: An idealistic porn producer aspires to elevate his craft to an art when he discovers a hot young talent.

Title: 78. Murder at 1600
description: A young woman is murdered in the White House. Homicide detective Regis investigates while Secret Service works against him. He's assigned agent Chance. She eventually cooperates after a man's framed.

Title: 79. Mimic
description: Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind.

Title: 80. Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil
description: A visiting city reporter's assignment suddenly revolves around the murder trial of a local millionaire, whom he befriends.

Title: 81. Good Burger
description: A dim-witted teenager and his new coworker try to save the old burger joint they work for from failing after the opening of a brand new burger restaurant across the street, which is planning to put them out of business.

Title: 82. Hoodlum
description: Black gangsters in 1930 Harlem fights Dutch Schultz who is trying to horn in on their numbers racket.

Title: 83. Air Bud
description: An unexpected player joins the school basketball team - a circus dog who escaped from a cruel master.

Title: 84. The Borrowers
description: A secret family of four-inch people living inside the walls of a house must save their home from an evil real estate developer.

Title: 85. Red Corner
description: An American attorney on business in China is wrongfully arrested and put on trial for murder, with a female defense lawyer from the country the only key to proving his innocence.

Title: 86. Mr. Magoo
description: The myopic millionaire defeats jewel smugglers in his usual bumbling manner.

Title: 87. Booty Call
description: Two friends who have gone too long without sex set out to get some.

Title: 88. The Apostle
description: After his happy life spins out of control, a preacher from Texas changes his name, goes to Louisiana and starts preaching on the radio.

Title: 89. Gone Fishin'
description: Two lifelong fishing buddies must overcome a series of obstacles to enjoy their ultimate fishing trip.

Title: 90. That Darn Cat
description: A maid is kidnapped and scratches a message onto D.C. the cat's collar and when his owner Patti discovers this, she plays amateur detective with the help of D.C. to try to find the culprits.

Title: 91. The Postman
description: A nameless drifter dons a postman's uniform and bag of mail as he begins a quest to inspire hope to the survivors living in post-apocalyptic America.

Title: 92. That Old Feeling
description: A bride's divorced parents find their old feelings for each other during the wedding reception and over the course of the next few days upsetting the newlywed's honeymoon.

Title: 93. Fire Down Below
description: A federal agent uncovers lucrative toxic waste dumps in Appalachia and must deal with the locals who want to keep their 'gold mine' secret.

Title: 94. Wishmaster
description: A demonic djinn attempts to grant its owner three wishes, which will allow him to summon his brethren to Earth.

Title: 95. RocketMan
description: Fred Z. Randall is a geeky spacecraft designer who gets the chance to make his dream come true and travel to Mars.

Title: 96. Eve's Bayou
description: What did little Eve see--and how will it haunt her? Husband, father and womanizer, Louis Batiste, is the head of an affluent family, but it's the women who rule this gothic world of secrets, lies and mystic forces.

Title: 97. The Sixth Man
description: A college athlete returns from the dead to help his brother's basketball team win the NCAA title.

Title: 98. Excess Baggage
description: A bratty teenager fakes her own kidnapping, but gets mistakenly kidnapped for real instead.

Title: 99. FairyTale: A True Story
description: In 1917, two children take a photograph, which is soon believed by some to be the first scientific evidence of the existence of fairies.

Title: 100. How to Be a Player
description: A playboy gets the tables turned on him when a party is arranged with all of the women he has been two-timing are in attendance.

Title: 101. The Man Who Knew Too Little
description: Wallace Ritchie is mistaken for a spy and must stop a plot to assassinate international leaders at a banquet.

Title: 102. The Wings of the Dove
description: An impoverished woman who has been forced to choose between a privileged life with her wealthy aunt and her journalist lover, befriends an American heiress. When she discovers the heiress is attracted to her own lover and is dying, she sees a chance to have both the privileged life she cannot give up and the lover she cannot live without.

Title: 103. Trial and Error
description: An actor poses as a lawyer to help his sick friend, and problems develop.

Title: 104. Rosewood
description: A dramatization of a 1923 horrific racist lynch mob attack on an African-American community.

Title: 105. Mr. Nice Guy
description: A Chinese chef accidentally gets involved with a news reporter who filmed a drug bust that went awry, and is now being chased by gangs who are trying to get the video tape.

Title: 106. Gattaca
description: Vincent, an "In-Valid", assumes the identity of a member of the genetic elite to pursue his goal of traveling into space with the Gattaca Aerospace Corporation. However, a week before his mission, a murder marks Vincent as a suspect.

Title: 107. Love Jones
description: Darius Lovehall is a young black poet in Chicago who starts dating Nina Mosley, a beautiful and talented photographer. While trying to figure out if they've got a "love thing" or are just "kicking it," they hang out with their friend, talking about love and sex. Then Nina tests the strength of Darius' feelings and sets a chain of romantic complications into motion.

Title: 108. Chasing Amy
description: Holden and Banky are comic book artists. Everything's going good for them until they meet Alyssa, also a comic book artist. Holden falls for her, but his hopes are crushed when he finds out she's a lesbian.

Title: 109. Turbulence
description: After a shootout on a flight transporting prisoners, a flight attendant must outwit a smooth-talking serial killer and land the plane herself.

Title: 110. The Beautician and the Beast
description: A New York City cosmetologist, mistakenly thought to be a science teacher, is offered a job to teach the children of an Eastern European dictator.

Title: 111. Double Team
description: An international spy teams up with an arms dealer to escape from a penal colony and rescue his family from a terrorist.

Title: 112. Leave It to Beaver
description: Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver, age eight, has misadventures and learns life lessons in this entertaining, hilarious tale of a small-town Ohio family and the daily trials of life.

Title: 113. Deconstructing Harry
description: Suffering from writer's block and eagerly awaiting his writing award, Harry Block remembers events from his past and scenes from his best-selling books as characters, real and fictional, come back to haunt him.

Title: 114. Mad City
description: A distraught man inadvertently takes a group of children hostage in a museum while a hungry, seasoned reporter tries to resurrect his career covering the story.

Title: 115. Buddy
description: A depiction of the true life story of Gertrude Lintz, an eccentric 1920's socialite who tries to raise a gorilla, like many chimps before him, as part of her family.

Title: 116. The Spanish Prisoner
description: An employee who develops a lucrative secret process for his corporation is tempted to betray the company when higher ups attempt to take the process from him. Dastardly intrigue ensues.

Title: 117. Fierce Creatures
description: Zookeepers struggle to deal with the policies of changing directors.

Title: 118. Mrs. Brown
description: When Queen Victoria descends into deep mourning after the death of her husband Prince Albert in 1861, she finds solace in her trusted servant, Mr. John Brown, but their relationship also brings scandal and turmoil.

Title: 119. Ulee's Gold
description: A reclusive beekeeper slowly pulls his dysfunctional family back together, but not without having to fight his son's previous dastardly cohorts.

Title: 120. Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie
description: A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent her plan.

Title: 121. A Simple Wish
description: A bumbling fairy godfather tries to grant a girl's wish that her cabbie father lands a Broadway role.

Title: 122. The Ice Storm
description: In 1973 suburbia, several middle-class families experimenting with substance abuse and the swinging lifestyle find their lives spinning beyond their control.

Title: 123. A Thousand Acres
description: A family is torn apart after a father gives his valuable farm land to his daughters.

Title: 124. Sprung
description: Two pairs of best friends - Montel & Clyde and Brandy & Adina meet at the party, where Clyde makes Adina think he is very rich and gets her into bed the same evening. When Adina finds out that she's been fooled, she becomes Clyde's worst enemy. Meanwhile Montel and Brandy fall in love and plan to marry, and Adina and Clyde try to do everything to stop them.

Title: 125. Wild America
description: Three brothers who are obsessed with animals are given permission from their parents to travel around America with a camera documenting wildlife.

Title: 126. She's So Lovely
description: After being released from a psychiatric institution, a man tries to redeem himself in the eyes of his now-ex wife from the events that led up to his incarceration.

Title: 127. B*A*P*S
description: Two tacky homegirls move to L.A. to become dancers; instead they scam a dying millionaire but eventually become B*A*P*S (Black American Princesses).

Title: 128. Zeus and Roxanne
description: A touching friendship story between a dog and a dolphin.

Title: 129. Star Kid
description: Spencer Griffith's life changes when a meteor falls into a local junkyard, and he finds a Cybersuit, an exoskeleton with AI from another galaxy. When Spencer puts on the Cybersuit he becomes a different kind of person.

Title: 130. U Turn
description: A man heading to Vegas to pay off his gambling debt before the Russian mafia kills him is forced to stop in an Arizona town where everything that can go wrong does go wrong.

Title: 131. Warriors of Virtue
description: A young boy is whisked away to the mythical land of Tao where he becomes the center of a conflict between an evil lord and a group of animal warriors.

Title: 132. Switchback
description: An FBI agent tries to catch a serial killer who kidnapped his son.

Title: 133. Most Wanted
description: A Marine on death row is recruited by a shadowy U.S. military officer as part of a top-secret ops team, then gets framed for murder when the team and its officer set him up as the fall guy for the assassination of the First Lady.

Title: 134. Affliction
description: A deeply troubled small-town cop investigates a suspicious hunting death while other events jeopardize his sanity.

Title: 135. Kull the Conqueror
description: A barbarian warrior becomes a king when he defeats a king in armed combat and the king's heir conspire to overthrow him and reclaim the throne by resurrecting an evil sorceress.

Title: 136. The Boxer
description: Young Danny Flynn is released from prison 14 years after "taking the rap" for the IRA and tries to rebuild his life in his old Belfast neighborhood.

Title: 137. Inventing the Abbotts
description: Two working class brothers court three wealthy and beautiful sisters in a small Illinois town.

Title: 138. Gang Related
description: After murdering an undercover DEA agent, two corrupt cops scramble to cover up what they've done.

Title: 139. One Eight Seven
description: 15 months after being stabbed 9 times by a student at work as a high school teacher in NYC, Mr. Garfield is working in LA as a substitute teacher come full-time. He refuses to be a victim anymore.

Title: 140. Kundun
description: From childhood to adulthood, Tibet's fourteenth Dalai Lama deals with Chinese oppression and other problems.

Title: 141. Gridlock'd
description: Two friends try to kick their drug addiction after a friend dies from an overdose, when they try to enroll in a detox program, things quickly go wrong.

Title: 142. Dangerous Ground
description: Vusi Madlazi returns to the South African village he left as a young boy (he was organizing against apartheid and left in fear of his life) to bury his father. He meets up with his brother Ernest, who tells him he couldn't contact their other brother Stephen. Vusi goes to Johannesburg to find him, but at first can only find his neighbor/girlfriend Karin, a stripper. Vusi proceeds to learn how conditions have changed since the end of apartheid: not always for the better for Black men.

Title: 143. Princess Mononoke
description: While seeking to cure himself of a curse, young warrior Ashitaka stumbles into a conflict between the people of Iron Town and Princess Mononoke, a girl raised by wolves, who will stop at nothing to prevent the destruction of her home.

Title: 144. Les Boys
description: Male bonding and clich√©s through an amateur hockey team's antics. Every relatable male stereotype is amusingly dissected.

Title: 145. McHale's Navy
description: A retired Navy officer returns to active duty, along with a group of misfit sailors, to battle his former nemesis.

Title: 146. A Life Less Ordinary
description: Upon being fired, a desperate guy kidnaps a daughter of his former boss. Two angels are sent to Earth to check if love is possible in this case.

Title: 147. Playing God
description: A disgraced surgeon leaves his former life and reinvents himself as a gunshot doctor in the criminal underworld.

Title: 148. Meet Wally Sparks
description: Wally Sparks is a tabloid television show reporter, who's trying to boost ratings on his show. He goes to the Governor's mansion to uncover a sex scandal.

Title: 149. Lost Highway
description: Anonymous videotapes presage a musician's murder conviction, and a gangster's girlfriend leads a mechanic astray.

Title: 150. 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag
description: Mob bag-man Tommy Spinelli finds that his luggage, containing the proof of his gang's latest hit, has been switched with a bag belonging to college student Charlie who is on a Mexican vacation with his girlfriend Laurie and her parents.

Title: 151. The Pest
description: A Miami con man agrees to be the human target for a Neo-Nazi manhunter in order to collect $50,000 if he survives.

Title: 152. Cats Don't Dance
description: Danny, an ambitious singing and dancing cat, goes to Hollywood and overcomes several obstacles to fulfill his dream of becoming a movie star.

Title: 153. 'Til There Was You
description: Two strangers, whose paths are always crossing, finally meet when fate steps in.

Title: 154. Free Willy 3: The Rescue
description: 16-year-old Jesse and old friend Randolph try to foil an illegal whaler threatening Willy and his pregnant mate.

Title: 155. The MatchMaker
description: A senator's aide visits Ireland seeking his family roots during a matchmaking festival. As an attractive single woman, she catches the eye of two matchmakers and a bartender.

Title: 156. A Smile Like Yours
description: Greg Kinnear plays a carriage-shy husband in a romantic comedy about a couple trying to conceive a child.

Title: 157. Mrs Dalloway
description: In 1923 London, socialite Clarissa Dalloway's well-planned party is overshadowed by the return of an old suitor she had known thirty-three years earlier.

Title: 158. The Sweet Hereafter
description: A bus crash in a small town brings a lawyer to defend the families, but he discovers everything isn't what it seems.

Title: 159. Love! Valour! Compassion!
description: Gregory invites 7 friends to his secluded home: Bobby, couple Art and Perry, John, Ramon, AIDS-afflicted James, HIV+ Buzz. They spend the summer navigating relationships, illnesses, and personal dynamics.

Title: 160. In the Company of Men
description: Two business executives--one an avowed misogynist, the other recently emotionally wounded by his love interest--set out to exact revenge on the female gender by seeking out the most innocent, uncorrupted girl they can find and ruining her life.

Title: 161. One Night Stand
description: Max has a one night stand with Karen in New York City. He returns to his wife, two kids and career in Los Angeles but is affected. A year later, Max and Karen meet again by chance, but this time they're with their spouses.

Title: 162. Love and Death on Long Island
description: Giles De'Ath (Sir John Hurt) is a widower who doesn't like anything modern. He goes to movies and falls in love with movie star Ronnie Bostock (Jason Priestly). He then investigates everything about the movie and Ronnie. After that, he travels to Long Island City, where Ronnie lives, and meets him, pretending that Ronnie is a great actor, and that's why Giles admires him.

Title: 163. Afterglow
description: A handyman with marital problems meets a housewife with the same.

Title: 164. Career Girls
description: Two young women reunite and rekindle their friendship after having said goodbye at their college graduation six years earlier.

Title: 165. Smilla's Sense of Snow
description: A 6 y.o. Inuit boy runs off a snowy roof in Copenhagen and dies. Smilla, a half Inuit who lives in the building and knows the boy, looks into it. What makes an acrophobic boy run up on the roof? The clues take her to Greenland.

Title: 166. Shadow Conspiracy
description: Bishop, trusted advisor to the president, has shots fired at him when Pachenko comes to him about a traitor in highest level of government. He gets away from the cold blooded assassin twice. Will he find the traitor before getting killed?

Title: 167. Snowriders II
description: Travel across the globe to ski places like New Zealand, Canada, and even Kazakhstan with insane snowriders like Chris Davenport, Amy Wheeler, and Justin Patnode.

Title: 168. Chinese Box
description: The story of Hong Kong, from New Year's Day to June 30th, 1997, when the British left their colony and turned it over to the People's Republic of China.

Title: 169. Ma vie en rose
description: Ludovic is an innocent seven-year-old child who provokes horror in his community when he dresses in girls clothes and insists he's a girl.

Title: 170. Wilde
description: The turmoil in poet/playwright Oscar Wilde's life after he discovers his homosexuality.

Title: 171. Two Girls and a Guy
description: Two girls wait outside a young actor's door and find out he's had them both as "only" girlfriend the last ten months. They wait inside after breaking in. When Blake comes home he just can't stop lying but they stay.

Title: 172. Paradise Road
description: A group of women who are imprisoned on the island of Sumatra by the Japanese during World War II use music to relieve their misery.

Title: 173. The Butcher Boy
description: The antisocial son of an alcoholic father and a bipolar mother grows up in 1960s Ireland.

Title: 174. Masterminds
description: Trapped in a school in which a gang of criminals has seized control, a young troublemaker fights a cat and mouse battle from inside.

Title: 175. Kiss Me, Guido
description: Warren has an extra room in his apartment (and is five months behind on the rent) after his lover moves out, so a friend places an ad on his behalf for a GWM roommate. Frankie, a pizza baker (and aspiring actor), decides to move out of his family's flat in The Bronx when he comes home one evening and walks in on his brother making love to Frankie's girlfriend. Frankie checks ads for roommates in "the city" (i.e., Manhattan), notices Warren's ad and decides to answer it, reasoning that GWM stands for "Guy With Money."

Title: 176. Oscar and Lucinda
description: In mid-1800s England, Oscar is a young Anglican priest, a misfit and an outcast, but with the soul of an angel. As a boy, even though from a strict Pentecostal family, he felt God told him through a sign to leave his father and his faith and join the Church of England. Lucinda is a teen-aged Australian heiress who has an almost desperate desire to liberate her sex from the confines of the male-dominated culture of the Australia of that time. She buys a glass factory and has a dream of building a church made almost entirely of glass, and then transporting it to Bellingen, a remote settlement on the north coast. Oscar and Lucinda meet on a ship going to Australia; once there, they are for different reasons ostracized from society, and as a result "join forces" together. Oscar and Lucinda are both passionate gamblers, and Lucinda bets Oscar her entire inheritance that he cannot transport the glass church to the Outback safely. Oscar accepts her wager, and this leads to the events that will change both their lives forever.

Title: 177. Washington Square
description: In this adaptation of the Henry James novel set in 19th-century New York City, a wealthy spinster with an overbearing father is pursued by a handsome fortune hunter who may be only after her money.

Title: 178. Live Flesh
description: After leaving jail, V√≠ctor is still in love with Elena, but she's married to the former cop -now basketball player- who became paralysed by a shot from V√≠ctor's gun...

Title: 179. Suicide Kings
description: A group of youngsters kidnap a respected Mafia figure.

Title: 180. Steel
description: A scientist for the military turns himself into a cartoon-like superhero when a version of one of his own weapons is being used against enemies.

Title: 181. Rhyme & Reason
description: A study in the world of hip-hop, done mostly with interviews, in order to see why it is as popular as it is today and what the future holds.

Title: 182. City of Industry
description: A retired thief swears revenge on the lunatic who murdered his brother and partner, while going on the run with the loot they stole.

Title: 183. Nueba Yol 3: Bajo la nueva ley
description: Balbuena finds himself forced to find an American wife in order to get legal residence before the new immigration laws take effect.

Title: 184. Henry Fool
description: An introverted garbageman writes his thoughts in a notebook after Henry Fool, writer and ex-con, rents the basement and gives him a notebook and the idea. He writes poetry and Henry helps him along.

Title: 185. Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
description: Concurrent theatrical ending of the TV series Neon Genesis Evangelion (1995).

Title: 186. Nightwatch
description: A law student is suspected of serial killings.

Title: 187. The Thief
description: A woman meets a man who isn't the right man for her - but she hasn't realised it yet...

Title: 188. D√©j√† Vu
description: L.A. shop owner Dana and Englishman Sean meet and fall in love at first sight, but Sean is married and Dana is to marry her business partner Alex.

Title: 189. The Tango Lesson
description: A scriptwriter comes to Paris to work on her film. There she takes up tango lessons and forms a relationship with the dancer.

Title: 190. Lolita
description: An English professor falls for a minor, and has to face the consequences of his actions.

Title: 191. Children of Heaven
description: After a boy loses his sister's pair of shoes, he goes on a series of adventures in order to find them. When he can't, he tries a new way to "win" a new pair.

Title: 192. Men with Guns
description: Humberto Fuentes is a wealthy doctor whose wife has recently died. In spite of the advice of his children, he takes a trip to visit his former students who now work in impoverished villages. His trip soon becomes a quest, politically awakening him when he finds out that one of his students was killed by the army.

Title: 193. Fast, Cheap & Out of Control
description: An exploration of the careers of four unrelated professionals: a lion tamer, a robotics expert, a topiary gardener, and a naked mole rat specialist.

Title: 194. The Castle
description: A working-class family from Melbourne, Australia fights city hall after being told they must vacate their beloved family home to allow for infrastructural expansion.

Title: 195. The Winter Guest
description: A recent widow, who is determined to leave Scotland for Australia with her son, gets an unexpected visit from her aging mother.

Title: 196. Anna Karenina
description: Anna (Marceau) is a wife and mother who has an affair with the handsome Count Vronsky (Bean). Based on the novel by Tolstoy.

Title: 197. Kiss or Kill
description: After a robbery scam that goes bad, lovers Nikki and Al take off into the Australian outback, pursued by the police and a malevolent footballer named Zipper Doyle, and meet a number of offbeat characters.

Title: 198. Firelight
description: In 1838, Elisabeth agrees to bear a child for an anonymous landowner who'll pay her father's debt. Employed as a governess on a Sussex estate, Mr. Godwin turns out to be the landowner.

Title: 199. The Big One
description: On his book tour, Michael Moore exposes wrongdoing by big greedy businesses and callous politicians around America.

Title: 200. Star Maps
description: Only in America. Only in Hollywood. Only in Beverly Hills could a young man with a dream make his way to the stars. Carlos is a precocious 18 year-old who returns to America from Mexico with dreams of becoming a movie star.

Title: 201. The House of Yes
description: A mentally unbalanced young woman - who is convinced she is Jackie Kennedy - flies into a murderous rage when her brother returns home to reveal he is engaged.

Title: 202. Character
description: Jacob Katadreuffe lives mute with his mother, has no contact with his father who only works against him and wants to become a lawyer, at all costs.

Title: 203. Orgazmo
description: Naive young Mormon Joe Young is recruited to act in porn movies.

Title: 204. Prefontaine
description: Based on the life of Olympic hopeful Steve Prefontaine, a long distance runner who lived in Oregon and died young.

Title: 205. Deceiver
description: A hooker is found cut in two. Two cops give polygraph tests to the only suspect, James Wayland (Tim Roth), an unstable genius. After some time, the roles change.

Title: 206. Hands on a Hardbody: The Documentary
description: Twenty-four contestants compete in an endurance/sleep deprivation contest in order to win a brand new Nissan Hardbody truck. The last person to remain standing with his or her hand on the truck wins. An absurd marketing gimmick at first glance, the contest proves to be much more...

Title: 207. Perfect Blue
description: A pop singer gives up her career to become an actress, but she slowly goes insane when she starts being stalked by an obsessed fan and what seems to be a ghost of her past.

Title: 208. Commandments
description: His wife dies, his house destroyed, gets fired and his dog struck by lightning, when he shouts "Why?" at God. He decides to break all ten commandments. He moves in with his sister-in-law and cheating reporter husband.

Title: 209. Dream with the Fishes
description: Terry is a suicidal voyeur who treats a dying addict to a final binge, but Terry will only do this if he promises to kill him.

Title: 210. Clockwatchers
description: The relationship between four female temps all working for the same credit company is threatened with the arrival of a new hire, who lands a permanent position one of the women was vying for.

Title: 211. Traveller
description: A man joins a group of nomadic con artists in rural North Carolina.

Title: 212. Wild Man Blues
description: Academy Award-winner Barbara Kopple directs this documentary portrait of Academy Award and Golden Globe-winner Woody Allen, seen traveling with friends and fellow musicians during their New Orleans jazz band's 1996 European tour. Allen's relationship with his wife Soon-Yi Previn is captured on film here for the first time, and others on the European jaunt include Allen's sister Letty Aronson. Followed by press, paparazzi, and gushing admirers, Allen returns home to face a more realistic critical assessment during "the lunch from hell" with his aged parents.

Title: 213. Boys Life 2
description: Compilation of four short films about homoerotic situations involving young men. Tom DeCerchio directed "Nunzio's Second Cousin", telling the story of a gay cop who forces a gay-basher to come to his house and have dinner with his family. In "Alkali, Iowa", by Mark Christopher, a young gay man finds out some of his father's past secrets. And "Must Be the Music", by Nickolas Perry, follows four teenagers looking for love in nightclubs.

Title: 214. The Myth of Fingerprints
description: A few days spent in close proximity to each other soon leads to family secrets and old resentments being revealed, which threaten to splinter an already dysfunctional family.

Title: 215. Pippi Longstocking
description: Pippi is a little girl who lives alone in her house, while her father is sailing the seas. With Pippi we meet her horse, her monkey and her two friends Tommy and Anika. Together they go on many journeys through the neighborhood.

Title: 216. Cube
description: A group of strangers awaken to find themselves placed in a giant cube. Each one of them is gifted with a special skill and they must work together to escape an endless maze of deadly traps.

Title: 217. Fireworks
description: Nishi leaves the police in the face of harrowing personal and professional difficulties. Spiraling into depression, he makes questionable decisions.

Title: 218. Bent
description: In 1930s Berlin, a gay Jew is sent to a concentration camp under the Nazi regime.

Title: 219. The Eel
description: A businessman kills his adulterous wife and is sent to prison. After the release, he opens a barbershop and meets new people, talking almost to no one except an eel he befriended while in prison.

Title: 220. My Son the Fanatic
description: Pakistani taxi-driver Parvez and prostitute Bettina find themselves trapped in the middle when Islamic fundamentalists decide to clean up their local town.

Title: 221. Four Days in September
description: Brazillian urban guerrilla fighters kidnap the American Ambassador. Now, the diplomat's life hangs in the balance - helplessly caught between a government unwilling to cooperate - and his fear of the captors themselves.

Title: 222. Swept from the Sea
description: The story of Russian emigrant Yanko Goorall and servant Amy Foster in the end of nineteenth century. When Yanko enters a farm, sick and hungry after a shipwreck, everyone is afraid of him, except for Amy.

Title: 223. Lucie Aubrac
description: A love story or a tale of the resistance, this poignant movie tells both the haunting story of a French resistance cell in Lyon but also the love of Lucie Aubrac for her husband, and the lengths she goes to to rescue her husband from prison on more than one occasion. Based on a true story Lucie Aubrac works as both history lesson and love story.

Title: 224. Touch
description: At the discovery of his ability to work miracles, Juvenal becomes a media sensation, but now he's prone to those who want to exploit him.

Title: 225. The End of Violence
description: Mike is a successful Hollywood producer of violent movies. Then he himself experiences extreme violence, goes missing, joins some Latino gardeners and reviews his life.

Title: 226. Steam: The Turkish Bath
description: Francesco inherits an old palace from a Turkish aunt and moves to Istanbul to renovate it.

Title: 227. Hurricane Streets
description: A teenage petty criminal dreams of escaping his increasingly unlawful lifestyle when he meets a sweet girl who hopes to one day travel to Alaska.

Title: 228. Shooting Fish
description: Two con artists' plan to steal enough for a house are twisted when a pretty girl enters the picture.

Title: 229. Open Your Eyes
description: A very handsome man finds the love of his life, but he suffers an accident and needs to have his face rebuilt by surgery after it is severely disfigured.

Title: 230. Artemisia
description: Artemisia Gentileschi (1593-1653) was one of the first well-known female painters. The movie tells the story of her youth, when she was guided and protected by her father, the painter Orazio Gentileschi. Her professional curiosity about the male anatomy, forbidden for her eyes, led her to the knowledge of sexual pleasure. But she was also well known because in 1612 she had to appear in a courtroom because her teacher, Agostino Tassi, was suspected of raping her. She tried to protect him, but was put in the thumb screws...

Title: 231. The Second Jungle Book: Mowgli & Baloo
description: The story of Mowgli, a young boy abandoned in the wilds of India. Raised by a panther, an elephant and a bear, Mowgli must learn civilization's ways when his long-lost uncle and a circus scout from Barnum and Bailey come looking for him.

Title: 232. I Think I Do
description: A screwball comedy about a gay couple at a straight couple's wedding.

Title: 233. Welcome to Sarajevo
description: American and British journalists Flynn and Michael Henderson, along with their respective news teams, meet at the beginning of the Bosnian war in Sarajevo. During their reports, the group find an orphanage run by the devoted Mrs. Savic near the frontline. Feeling sympathy, Henderson decides to take one of the children, Emira, illegally back to England.

Title: 234. The Assignment
description: An American naval officer is recruited for an operation to eliminate his lookalike, the infamous terrorist Carlos The Jackal.

Title: 235. The Education of Little Tree
description: Little Tree is an 8-year-old Cherokee boy who loses his parents during The Great Depression and begins living with his Indian grandparents and learning the Cherokee way of life.

Title: 236. Winter Sleepers
description: In a small mountain town, a man looking for revenge because of his daughter's accidental killing, mistakenly tracks out a young couple who are troubled enough by ordinary life problems.

Title: 237. Happy Together
description: A couple take a trip to Argentina but both men find their lives drifting apart in opposite directions.

Title: 238. Telling Lies in America
description: A loner befriends a local celebrity, Billy Magic, but he soon begins to tell lies in order to maintain the friendship and the newfound status.

Title: 239. Trekkies
description: Denise Crosby takes a first look at the huge fans of "Star Trek" and how the series from around America has affected and shaped their lives.

Title: 240. Mr. Jealousy
description: A writer becomes obsessed with his girlfriend's former boyfriend, now a very successful novelist. To discover if the ex-boyfriend still has feeling for his old love, the writer joins the novelist's group therapy meetings.

Title: 241. Bliss
description: A newly married happy couple visits a sex therapist to determine why the wife can't achieve an orgasm with her husband. This causes a horrific suppressed memory to emerge and she becomes more and more distant.

Title: 242. All Over Me
description: Claude and Ellen are best friends who live in a not-so-nice area of New York. They're involved in the subculture of '90s youth, complete with drugs, live music, and homophobia. All is changed one night when a violent, meaningless death rocks their lives.

Title: 243. Marius and Jeannette
description: Marius is the keeper of an abandoned cement works staying high above the quarter of l'Estaque in Marseilles. Jeannette is bringing up her two children alone with her poor checkout operator salary. Their meeting won't be without trouble, since besides material difficulties, both of them are wounded by life. They have to learn how to be happy again.

Title: 244. Nil by Mouth
description: A rough, short-tempered patriarch of a working-class family sees his life and the relationships around him slowly unravel.

Title: 245. The Swindle
description: Betty and Victor are a pair of scam artists. One day Betty brings in Maurice, a treasurer of a multinational company. Maurice is due to transfer 5 millions francs out of Switzerland, and Betty is convinced he plans to steal that money.

Title: 246. Passion in the Desert
description: Young French officer Augustin Robert escorts artist Jean-Michel Venture de Paradis to Egypt during Napoleon's Egyptian campaign. Napoleon sent de Paradis to record Egypt's great monuments and temples that are destroyed by French soldiers in acts of barbarism. During combat, Augustin and Jean-Michel are separated from their regiment, and they start wandering through the desert fighting for their life. In one of the canyons Augustin meets a leopard he names Simoom and a strange bond between them appears.

Title: 247. The Harmonists
description: The film chronicles the rise and fall of Germany's most famous a capella group, the Comedian Harmonists, in 1930s Germany.

Title: 248. Still Breathing
description: When artist and street performer Fletcher (Brendan Fraser) thinks con-artist Roz (Joanna Going) is the woman he has seen in a vision, he has no idea she sees him as her next victim.

Title: 249. Insomnia
description: In a Norwegian city with a 24-hour daylight cycle a Swedish murder investigator has been brought in on a special case. Sleep deprived, he makes a horrible mistake which is discovered by the killer he has been hunting.

Title: 250. Critical Care
description: A hospital resident is put in the middle of a legal battle between two half-sisters on whether to pull their comatose dad's life support. But more seems to be at stake than dad's life - his inheritance.

Title: 251. The Designated Mourner
description: Jack and Judy are husband and wife, and Howard is Judys father. They live in some fictional undemocratic and repressive country, and tell us a story about their lives, mostly from Jack's point of view.

Title: 252. Niagara, Niagara
description: An outsider and a young woman plagued by Tourette's syndrome meet and together journey to Canada.

Title: 253. I Married a Strange Person!
description: A newlywed develops a strange lump on his neck that gives him the ability to transform people or objects at will. His wife is very upset. Meanwhile, the CEO of Smilecorp learns of this man and his ability and sees a way to achieve world domination if only the man can be taken alive.

Title: 254. Latin Boys Go to Hell
description: A cute, openly gay latin boy's hormones go into overdrive when his hunky cousin (Angel) arrives for an extended stay. The two explore the young and sometimes dangerous gay scene in the city's Latin neighborhood, with surprising outcomes.

Title: 255. Nowhere
description: Follows a day in the lives of a group of Los Angeles high school students and the strange lives they lead.

Title: 256. Chairman of the Board
description: A surfer becomes the head of a major company.

Title: 257. Waco: The Rules of Engagement
description: A reassessment of the tragedy at Waco that left 76 members of the Branch Davidian religious sect dead.

Title: 258. Under the Skin
description: A woman explores her sexuality to cope with the passing of her mother, leading her to profound revelations about herself and the people closest to her.

Title: 259. 4 Little Girls
description: A documentary of the notorious racial terrorist 1963 bombing by the Ku Klux Klan of the African American 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham during the Civil Rights Movement, which killed four young girls.

Title: 260. Twin Town
description: Julian and Jeremy, two brothers prefer to spend their time on drugs and joyriding. When their father, Fatty Lewis, they show up demanding compensation.

Title: 261. The Night Flier
description: A reporter is on the trail of a vampiric murderer who travels by plane.

Title: 262. For Roseanna
description: Roseanna is dying of a heart condition, and all she wants is to be buried next to her daughter, in a cemetery that is getting full fast. The cemetery can't expand because Capestro, the man who owns the land next to the cemetery, won't sell. While Marcello is doing good deeds to make sure no one dies, Roseanna thinks of Marcello's future.

Title: 263. Gummo
description: Lonely residents of a tornado-stricken Ohio town wander the deserted landscape trying to fulfill their boring, nihilistic lives.

Title: 264. Going All the Way
description: After returning home from the Korean War, two young men search for love and fulfillment in middle America.

Title: 265. Truth or Consequences, N.M.
description: A group of crooks, an ex con, his friend and a gun crazy gangster plan a drug heist, but not everything goes as planned.

Title: 266. Lawn Dogs
description: When Devon, a 10-year-old girl, forges a friendship with Trent, a 21-year-old outsider who mows the neighborhood lawns, things suddenly get very complicated and private.

Title: 267. I Love You, Don't Touch Me!
description: The story of a 25 year old virgin girl, looking for the right boyfriend, not realizing that "the one" has been next to her for many years.

Title: 268. TwentyFourSeven
description: In a typical English working-class town, the juveniles have nothing more to do than hang around in gangs. One day, Alan Darcy, a highly motivated man with the same kind of youth experience, starts trying to get the young people off the street and into doing something they can believe in: Boxing. Soon he opens a training facility which is accepted gratefully by them and the gangs start to grow together into friends. Darcy manages to organize a public fight for them to prove what they have learned. A training camp with hiking tours into the mountains of Wales forge the group into a tight-knit club society. With the day of the fight drawing closer, the young boxers get more and more excited.

Title: 269. The Ride
description: A has-been cowboy is given a second chance at the hands of an unexpected teacher.

Title: 270. The Real Blonde
description: Joe and Mary live in Manhattan. She's the breadwinner, working as makeup artist. He's a wannabe actor working as waiter. When a friend gets a soap part ($3600/wk), Joe lowers his standard.

Title: 271. Seventh Heaven
description: Mathilde is suffering from depression and kleptomania. Her surgeon husband, Nicolas, wonders why. She decides to visit a hypnotist.

Title: 272. Genealogies of a Crime
description: At her son's funeral, Solange, a lawyer famous for losing hopeless cases, agrees to defend Ren√©, her son's age, accused of murdering his wealthy aunt, Jeanne, who's part of the Franco-Belgian Psychoanalytic Society, known for odd views and methods. She reads Jeanne's journal, documenting Ren√©'s criminal tendencies. Solange believes him innocent, manipulated into the murder or framed. Odd psychiatrists turn up, including Georges Didier, who runs FBPS, and his rival, Christian, who believes crime originates in a story's taking hold of a person. After the verdict, Ren√© and Solange's relationship changes, Georges and his society commit a bizarre act, and the police record Solange's story.

Title: 273. Office Killer
description: A mousy office worker accidentally kills one of her coworkers, then proceeds to bump off a few others.

Title: 274. Stiff Upper Lips
description: Spoofs Merchant-Ivory films: Aunt Agnes (Prunella Scales) tries to force Emily (Georgina Cates) to marry boring Cedric Trilling (Robert Portal) by taking her to Italy and India in hopes will forget about handsome George (Sean Pertwee).

Title: 275. Plump Fiction
description: Follows the plot of Pulp Fiction (1994). Scenes from other movies are also parodied.

Title: 276. The Mirror
description: When a young girl becomes lost in the hustle and bustle of Tehran, her journey turns into a dazzling exercise on the nature of film itself.

Title: 277. The Long Way Home
description: The story of the post World War II Jewish refugee situation from liberation to the establishment of the modern state of Israel.

Title: 278. The Alarmist
description: A young and hungry salesman lands a job with a company that installs alarm systems. He strikes up a sexual relationship with a woman client who is also a single mother and then learns some pretty unsavory things about the business.

Title: 279. Keys to Tulsa
description: Richter is a lazy son of a wealthy woman, who's put up with too much so no more money. He's about to lose his local newspaper job arranged by his mom. Richter owes money to a violent drug dealer/blackmailer but sees his wife. Death wish?

Title: 280. Six Ways to Sunday
description: Eighteen-year-old mothers' son Harry (he lives with his overprotective mother Kate) shows his cruel side at one occasion and is hired as hitman/enforcer by the Jewish mob.

Title: 281. A Brother's Kiss
description: Two brothers, Lex and younger Mick, are living in Harlem. Mick is a policeman, and Lex, who spent youth years in reformatory because of injustice after he confronted the cop who tried to sodomize Mick on the street, is living with his wife Debbie trying to make ends meet and failing. One day Lex calls Mick - he has a problem...

Title: 282. The Only Thrill
description: Reece McHenry is a used-clothing store owner and Carol Fitzsimmons is a seamstress working in that store. This is the story of their relationships from 1960s till present time.

Title: 283. Julian Po
description: Christian Slater stars as a mysterious drifter whose life takes a fateful turn when he stops at a sleepy small town.

Title: 284. This World, Then the Fireworks
description: In 1950s, two incestuous lovers, a depraved suave journalist and his equally depraved prostitute sister, plan to get rich through seduction and murder. Things complicate when their feeble-minded mother begins to suspect something.

Title: 285. Fall
description: Cab driver Michael and supermodel Sarah fall in love while her gorgeous husband Phillippe is in Madrid for two months.

Title: 286. The Last Time I Committed Suicide
description: In 1946 Denver, an aspiring writer who enjoys irresponsible adventures with his friend writes a letter about his life before and after the suicide attempt by his sad, commitment-seeking girlfriend.

Title: 287. An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn
description: When a rookie filmmaker with the unfortunate name Alan Smithee realizes he's an unwitting studio puppet, being forced to make a big-budget action movie he knows is horrible, he steals the master reels and tries to make a deal.

Title: 288. Digging to China
description: 10 y.o. Harriet's divorced mom owns and runs a motel. Harriet's an outsider and wants to leave. A woman stays there with her adult, disabled son who befriends Harriet.

Title: 289. First Love, Last Rites
description: Joey and Sissel are two misfits spending most of their time together talking or having sex. Gradually and slowly their relationships are becoming boring for them.

Title: 290. The Locusts
description: A drifter enters a small town looking for employment. While working at the local cattle ranch, he meets and falls in love with the beautiful Kitty and becomes involved in a deadly yet erotic love triangle.

Title: 291. Koyla
description: A village girl agrees to a marriage to a king she has never met after he sends her a photograph of himself. But the man in the photograph is not the king but his most loyal slave, the handsome but mute Shankar.

Title: 292. Welcome to Woop Woop
description: A con artist escapes a deal gone wrong in New York and winds up in the Aussie outback in a strange town whose inhabitants are an oddball collection of misfits.

Title: 293. Behind the Lines
description: Based on Pat Barker's novel of the same name, "Regeneration" tells the story of soldiers of World War One sent to an asylum for emotional troubles. Two of those soldiers are England's most important WW1 poets.

Title: 294. Bad Manners
description: Wes and Nancy are a married academics couple. One day they host Nancy's long-ago lover Matt and his current sexy girlfriend Kim. Matt is a musician and Kim is a computer specialist who helped Matt to make some discovery in his science. Wes suspects Kim of stealing 50 dollars from him and that starts tension, intrigues, mistrust.

Title: 295. Soul in the Hole
description: The life trials and tribulations of a group of young athletic men that struggle through everyday life supporting one another on the rough streets of a Brooklyn neighborhood, using basketball as their way out of a possible life of poverty.

Title: 296. Level Five
description: The French computer programmer Laura inherits the task of making a computer game of the Battle of Okinawa during World War II. She searches the internet for information on the battle, and interviews Japanese experts and witnesses. The extraordinary circumstances of the Battle of Okinawa lead Laura to reflect deeply on her own life and humanity in general, particularly the influence of history and memories.

Title: 297. Metroland
description: The sudden reappearance of his best friend Toni, after a ten year absence, causes Chris to remember his past, to question some of his lifestyle decisions and to re-evaluate his life and marriage to Marion.

Title: 298. Chicago Cab
description: A Chicago cab driver's night shift becomes a kaleidoscope of humanity. With each fare, his initial cold demeanor softens, revealing unexpected depth amid cameos from familiar faces.

Title: 299. Off the Menu: The Last Days of Chasen's
description: In 1995, Chasen's closed its doors after 60 years of serving chili to movie stars and visiting dignitaries, Presidents and the Pope. During its two final weeks, Chasen regulars (actors and producers), staff, and management sat for interviews. There's an Oscar party for 1500, footage and photos of famous diners, and time with Tommy Gallagher, the ebullient head waiter until retirement in 1994, his son Patrick, catering head Raymond Bilbool, general manager Ronnie Clint, hat check girl Val Schwab, ladies' room attendant Onetta Johnson, and foreign- born waiters, including Jaime. When he started in 1970, like other Latins, he wasn't allowed out of the kitchen. It's a family farewell.

Title: 300. The Manson Family
description: A dramatization of the horrific and notorious Manson Family Murders, in the form of super 8 home movies.

Title: 301. Made in Hong Kong
description: Autumn Moon (Sam Lee), a low-rent triad living in Hong Kong, struggles to find meaning in his hopelessly violent existence.

Title: 302. Dear Jesse
description: Can you go home again? What if you're a gay man and home is a state where voters keep electing a homophobe to the US Senate? In 1996, native son Tim Kirkman returns to North Carolina to explore the parallels and differences between himself and Jesse Helms: they're from the same town and college, with media interests, from families blessed by adoptions, Baptists by upbringing. Tim puts his camera in front of his family, a boyhood pal, college friends, his pastor, Helms fans, community activists, novelists Lee Smith and Allan Gurganus, a mayor who's gay, and people in the street, including a brief interview with Matthew Shepard. What is it to judge, and what is it to love?

Title: 303. Esmeralda Comes by Night
description: Esmeralda is married with 5 husbands at the same time, so she has to explain to the judge why she has done this.

Title: 304. Full Tilt Boogie
description: A documentary about the production of From Dusk Till Dawn (1996) and the people who made it.

Title: 305. Dry Cleaning
description: A bored couple takes in a young man who turns their lives inside out.

Title: 306. The Break
description: Dowd, who's IRA, escapes an Irish prison in a bloody jailbreak, making his way to New York City where he lives alone, avoids Irish hangouts, and works as a dishwasher. When a good deed gets him stabbed, one of the restaurant employees takes him in and finds him medical care. As Dowd recovers in the flat of Tulio and Tulio's sister Monica, he realizes that these Guatemalan exiles share his rebellious principles. When he learns they are planning a political assassination, he offers to help. His attraction to Monica contributes to his willingness to volunteer. However, the cops are closing in on him: can he make the hit, protect his new friends, and escape with Monica?

Title: 307. Hugo Pool
description: An LA pool cleaner/Alyssa Milano falls in love with a young man with ALS/Lou Gehrig's Disease.

Title: 309. Little Boy Blue
description: Nineteen-year-old Jimmy' s dad is a vicious, impotent Vietnam veteran who forces his wife and son to have incest. He has a secret he'll kill to keep. Jimmy won't abandon his two kid brothers by leaving.

Title: 310. Breaking Up
description: A couple circa 30 breaks up after 2 1/2 years - or do they?
